Web Typography Codepens

Feb 19, 2015

Today we started talking about typography and I loved every second of it. I've been interested in typography for a while and I'm so pumped to be nerding out about it and learning as much about it as we are.

To start the day off, we watched Helvetica, a documentary about the ubiquitous font and how it's shaped decades of typography. While watching the film, it became very clear to me that I'm a modernist. Minimal, organized, sturdy. I'm glad to have some perspective and focus on that now and can't wait to design something of my own.

Part of tonight's homework was to find inspiration in Design Is History and create Codepens based on our inspiration. Notice a trend?

See the Pen Typography 1 by Jesse Crow (@crowjm) on CodePen.

See the Pen Typography 2 by Jesse Crow (@crowjm) on CodePen.

See the Pen Typography 3 by Jesse Crow (@crowjm) on CodePen.

See the Pen Typography 4 by Jesse Crow (@crowjm) on CodePen.

See the Pen JoLejX by Jesse Crow (@crowjm) on CodePen.

colophon

Made with care by Jesse Crow deep in the heart of Texas. Powered by Jekyll, Typekit, and lots of tea. Typeset in Adelle and Proxima Nova.
